job.title: Software Test Engineer with Sign-On Bonus
job.description:
Why APCON
At APCON, we bring enthusiasm, passion, and dedication every day to building products that provide visibility into network data. Organizations ranging from midsize companies to Fortune 100 enterprises rely on APCON to achieve total visibility of their physical, private, and cloud environments. With APCON’s stable, scalable technology, IT professionals know they can monitor, secure, and protect their networks.
Purpose Of Job
The Software Test Engineer will be responsible for the testing and validation of APCON’s industry leading suite of network monitoring solutions.
Responsibilities
Responsible for software testing and validation of APCON’s industry leading suite of network monitoring solutions
Writes novel and creative test cases using best industry practices
Manually executes non-automated test cases
Assists development on bug fixes, bug isolation, and resolution
Delivers timely verification of fixes in response to generation of bugs
Advocates, develops, and deploys new testing/automation tools and concepts
Qualifications And Requirements
2+ years in a software/hardware test engineering role
Testing experience with IP networking, routing or switching technologies
Hands-on engineering lab experience testing hardware or software
Experience in formal software testing methodologies, including software development cycles, testing processes and standards
Familiar with defect and test case tracking tools
Testing experience with embedded Linux systems
Experience developing Python automated scripts (preferred)
Familiarity with Selenium automation framework (preferred)
Possess a willingness and ability to adapt to new processes, ideas, and concepts
Core Competencies
Strong interpersonal skills; ability to communicate professionally across the organization
Excellent organizational, planning, presentation, troubleshooting, and multi-tasking skills
Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality and professionalism
Strong attention to detail and exceptional customer support
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
Must be able to work independently and as a team member
Ability to prioritize and be flexible in a fast-paced environment
Education
Bachelor’s Degree preferred and/or equivalent in training and experience
Benefits
Sign-On Bonus (Terms and Conditions Apply)
Medical, dental and vision insurance
Company-paid short and long term disability
Flexible spending accounts
Healthy work-life balance and generous paid time off program
Retirement savings match
Professional development program
Volunteer time off and employee assistance plan
Collaborative and innovative work environment
On-site exercise facility
Physical Requirements
To perform the duties of this position, you must have the ability to occasionally sit, stand, bend, twist, reach, carry, lift, pull, and push between 1-15 lbs.
APCON is a drug-free workplace and EEO Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, natural origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or
other
legally protected status. Offers are contingent on the successful completion of
pre-employment
drug and background screenings. Please note that we follow Federal Guidelines regarding prohibited substances, even for those legal at the state level.
